;;一名男子站在废墟中看着他受损的房子
;

;一系列强烈地震的幸存者周六袭击阿富汗西部的袭击者在被摧毁的村庄废墟中度过了第二个晚上，他们用铲子寻找亲人，塔利班高级官员称死亡人数已接近 3,000 人。

;

;在该地区首府赫拉特市的人们睡在公园和街道上，担心进一步的地震。美国地质调查局 (USGS) 报告称，当地时间周一下午 2 点 16 分（英国夏令时 1046 年），赫拉特古尔兰区 Qarabagh 村中心东南 19 英里（30 公里）处发生了 4.7 级地震，另外还发生了 4.9 级地震。中午前夕，偏远地区发生地震。

;

;“我们担心该地区可能还会有更多人员伤亡，”一名塔利班官员表示。 “我们的团队目前正在向受影响地区提供援助。”

;

;;周六发生的 6.3 级地震;——随后发生八次强烈余震——震动了赫拉特附近难以到达的地区，农村房屋倒塌，惊慌失措的城市居民走上街头。阿富汗已经陷入了严峻的人道主义危机，;塔利班将于 2021 年重新掌权;。

;

;在官员早些时候将死亡人数为 2,445 人，卫生工作者表示他们不知所措。 “每分钟都有装满尸体的货车抵达这里，”赫拉特医院的一名医生说。 “我们正在与大量受伤人员作斗争。我没有数过尸体。我们的停尸房已经满了。”

;

;塔利班官员表示，自地震以来，周一首次抵达一些村庄。

;

;“救援行动仍在进行中。国防部部队今天上午已抵达该地区，当地居民正在积极协助行动。废墟下还有很多人，还有我们尚未到达的地区。”他说。 “至少有 20 个村庄完全被夷为平地，人们仍被埋在废墟下。”

;

;国际救援委员会警告称，由于被困幸存者无法获救，缺乏救援设备可能会增加阿富汗西部的死亡人数。< /p>;

;联合国移民机构向地区医院派遣了四辆救护车以及医生和心理社会支持顾问。至少三支流动医疗队正在前往受灾最严重的地区之一 Zenda Jan 地区的途中。

; ;

;非政府组织无国界医生组织在赫拉特地区医院搭建了五个医疗帐篷，最多可容纳80 名患者。

;

;来自 Koshkak 村的 Mohammad Javad 描述了 Zenda Jan 地区遭受的严重影响。

;

;“墙壁在短短两秒钟内就倒塌了，整个村庄都被卷入了洪水之中。”在同样的时间内变成废墟，”他在赫拉特的一所收容幸存者的学校里说道。 “我失去了一名家人，我的邻居也失去了至少四名亲人。全村一千多人，恐怕只有四分之一的人活了下来。这就像一个巨大的坟墓。”

;

;另一位幸存者通过电话告诉《卫报》：“自地震发生以来，我们没有得到任何援助。这里什么也没有留下，村里的每间房屋都遭到破坏。事情发生时，我和丈夫都在外面，我们幸存下来。许多人在这里丧生。”

;

;;2022 年 6 月，; 一场强烈地震袭击了阿富汗东部崎岖的山区，将石头和泥砖房屋夷为平地。

;

;“偏远地区的人们处于毁灭性的境地，他们需要食物、衣服和住所。他们本来就很穷，现在一无所有。”塔利班官员说道。

;

;与伊朗接壤的赫拉特省有超过 300 万人口，该省遭受了长达数年的干旱。这使许多农业社区陷入瘫痪。

;

;据塔利班官员称，受影响地区还包含许多最近从伊朗和巴基斯坦返回的难民。

;

;援助机构和非政府组织已呼吁国际社会的帮助。据塔利班称，目前来自伊朗和巴基斯坦的援助物资已抵达该地区。

;

;“随着冬季的临近，受影响地区很快就会经历极度寒冷的天气。许多家庭不仅失去了家园，也失去了主要的经济支柱。他们迫切需要立即援助和合适的庇护所，”赫拉特省省长努尔·艾哈迈德·伊斯兰贾尔周日表示。

; Mon, 09 Oct 2023 21:22:02 +0800 Katy Purry? Cats use technique similar to ‘vocal fry’, study showshttps://www.theguardian.com/science/2023/oct/09/cats-purr-technique-similar-vocal-fry-study-shows-katy-perry

;
;;Katy Perry – 和猫。
;

;科学家们破解了猫如何发出咕噜声的谜团表示他们认可的声音。事实证明，它们使用的技术与“发声油炸”惊人相似——歌手凯蒂·佩里和电视真人秀明星金·卡戴珊使用的沙哑声音。

;

;研究人员长期以来一直困惑于，像家猫可以发出低沉的呼噜声，而这种发声通常只有声带更长的动物（例如大象）才能发出。多年来，他们相信咕噜声是通过一种独特的机制产生的，该机制涉及发声腔中肌肉的周期性收缩和放松——这需要大脑持续的神经输入。

;

;然而，事实证明发出呼噜声需要更少的努力。奥地利维也纳大学克里斯蒂安·赫布斯特博士领导的研究人员在征得猫主人同意​​后，解剖了八只因绝症而被安乐死的猫的声带。然后，他们捏住动物的声带，并向其中注入潮湿的空气——大致类似于人类用来说话和发出声音的机制。这样做会产生自持振荡或来自所有语音盒的咕噜声，这表明噪音不需要来自大脑的持续输入。

;

;进一步的研究表明存在嵌入在语音盒中的大量纤维组织。声带。 “这可以解释这样一种体重只有几公斤的小动物如何能够定期发出令人难以置信的低频声音（20-30赫兹，或每秒一个周期）——甚至远低于人类声音产生的最低低音，” Herbst 说道，他的研究发表于 ;当前生物学;。

;

;在咆哮的猫科动物（例如狮子和老虎）中也发现了类似的结构。

;

;先前占主导地位的理论认为，猫依赖于一种在动物王国中似乎或多或少独特的机制，即动物的大脑向喉咙中的肌肉发送快速、连续的信号，导致它们每秒收缩 30 次，发出咕噜声。

;

;发声——新的研究提出了另一种解释——是我们的声音可以发出的最低声调，产生沙哑说话的效果。

;;黑色画布上呈现的硬币收藏
;

;与高地相连的一堆硬币酋长的硬币——可能是在试图逃离格伦科大屠杀徒劳时被藏起来的——在壁炉下被发现。

;

;17 世纪收藏的 36 枚硬币包括国际货币，被藏在下面一个大石壁炉的遗迹，据信曾是狩猎小屋或宴会厅。

;

;该遗址与格伦科 (Glen Coe) 的阿拉斯代尔·鲁阿德·麦克唐纳 (Alasdair Ruadh “Maclain” MacDonald) 有关，他是 1646-92 年的氏族酋长，他和他的家人是第一次詹姆斯党起义后大屠杀的受害者。

;

;麦克唐纳家族参加了 1689 年恢复英格兰和爱尔兰天主教詹姆斯二世和苏格兰七世天主教的努力在他的英国圣公会女儿玛丽和她的丈夫奥兰治威廉将他废黜后。

;

;随着政府军平息叛乱并寻求执行和平条款，该家族成为目标 - 表面上是因为他们是失败者之一及时宣誓效忠新教君主。 1692 年 2 月 13 日，估计有 82 名氏族成员被杀；包括麦克莱恩和他的妻子。

;

;在格拉斯哥大学 8 月份的一次挖掘过程中，在“麦克莱恩避暑别墅”发现的文物包括欧洲陶器、银币和铜币，其历史可追溯至 1500 年代至 1680 年代。< /p>;

;

;“总体数字是每年 1400 亿美元，首先新西兰惠灵顿维多利亚大学的伊兰·诺伊教授与同事丽贝卡·纽曼一起进行了这项研究，他说：“总而言之，这已经是一个很大的数字了。” “其次，当你将其与气候变化成本的标准量化（使用计算机模型）进行比较时，这些量化似乎低估了气候变化的影响。”

;

;诺伊说，有很多没有关于极端天气事件造成的死亡人数或经济损失的数据：“这表明我们 1,400 亿美元的总体数字是一个严重的轻描淡写。例如，他说，热浪死亡数据仅在欧洲可用。 “我们不知道整个撒哈拉以南非洲有多少人死于热浪。”

; ;

;据世界气象组织称，自 20 世纪 70 年代以来，报告的极端天气灾害损失增加了七倍。然而，将全球变暖的影响与人口增长、城市移民和更好的灾害报告分开是很困难的。

;

;这项研究，;发表在《自然通讯》杂志上;，根据气候变化如何加剧极端天气事件本身，采取了不同的方法。 ;数百项“归因”研究;现已完成，计算了如何更加频繁的全球变暖导致了极端天气事件。这样就可以估计仅由人为加热造成的损害的比例。

;

;研究人员将这些比例应用于;国际灾害数据库;，该数据库汇集了导致 10 人死亡、100 人受影响、或该国宣布进入紧急状态或请求国际援助的所有灾害的可用数据。

;

;中心估计是每年平均气候成本为 1,400 亿美元，范围在 600 亿至 2,300 亿美元之间。这些估计值远高于计算机模型的估计值，计算机模型基于全球平均温度的变化，而不是世界上越来越多的极端温度。

;

;总体气候成本最高的年份是 2003 年。 2008 年，热浪袭击欧洲；2008 年，纳尔吉斯热带气旋袭击缅甸；2010 年，干​​旱袭击索马里，热浪袭击俄罗斯。 2005 年和 2017 年飓风袭击美国时，财产损失更高，而美国的财产价值很高。

;

;该分析使用了 700 万美元生命损失的统计值，这是美国使用的数字的平均值和英国政府。 “很多人对我们给生命贴上价格标签的想法感到非常不舒服，”诺伊说。 “但这是非常标准的经济实践，之所以会出现，是因为最终我们需要对各种事物的投资[价值]做出决定。”

; ;

;Noy 表示，仅考虑对基础设施造成的经济损失就会严重影响富裕国家的成本估算，尽管极端天气对贫穷国家造成的损害。 He contrasted the $140bn damage estimate with the $100bn promised by rich nations to poorer ones, but yet to be delivered in full, and noted that 90% of that money is for cutting emissions. The figures also contrast with the subsidies of $7tn a year enjoyed by the fossil fuel industry.

;

;At the UN climate summit Cop27 in 2022, countries agreed to set up a loss and damage fund to help poorer nations to rebuild after climate-related disasters. “You can use our methodology to start putting numbers on how much money we need in the fund,” Noy said.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Global heating will push billions outside 'human climate niche';

;
;

;Ideally, he said, a quick attribution study on an extreme weather event would estimate the climate-related damage and lead to a rapid delivery of funds: “It would be a kind of insurance scheme for countries.” The methodology might also be useful for determining damages in climate lawsuits, he said.

;

;Dr Stéphane Hallegatte, at the World Bank and not part of the study team, said: “The key message is that climate change is visibly increasing global economic losses from disasters. This has been a topic of controversy, with some claiming that climate change effects are negligible compared with other factors like economic growth and urbanisation.”

;

;“This study looks at the attribution for the physical event – it's much simpler, robust, and it provides a convincing case,” he said. “It is an emerging field and uncertainties are really large. One lesson of the study is that global research centres – mostly located in rich countries – need to work more on what is happening in poorer countries.”

; Mon, 09 Oct 2023 19:22:01 +0800 The ex factor: Sam Bankman-Fried’s former girlfriend to testify in fraud trialhttps://www.theguardian.com/business/2023/oct/09/caroline-ellison-prosecution-witness-sam-bankman-fried-ftx-trial
;;2023-10-09T10:00:08Z;
;
;;Sam Bankman-Fried arrives for a bail hearing at Manhattan federal court on 11 August 2023 in New York City.
;

;;Sam Bankman-Fried;'s ;fraud trial; is poised to take a dramatic turn Tuesday when government prosecutors call Caroline Ellison – the former CEO of Alameda Research and the FTX founder's sometimes-girlfriend – as their star witness.

;

;Ellison will take the stand after FTX co-founder ;Gary Wang; completes his ;testimony;, prosecutors said Friday in Manhattan federal court. While her cooperation with prosecutors has long been known, the details of her testimony against her ex-partner could provide the deepest, most damning insight yet into the ;inner workings; of ;FTX; and Alameda, the cryptocurrency exchange's closely linked hedge fund, where she served dual roles as Bankman-Fried's business confidant and occasional lover.

;
;

;;Related: ;;'Math nerd' or crypto criminal? Question at heart of Sam Bankman-Fried's trial;

;
;

;Though she has yet to appear, Ellison has already been an integral figure in trial proceedings. The prosecution has hinted that it will use Ellison's testimony to pull back the veil on FTX and Alameda's allegedly extensive financial chicanery. For their part, Bankman-Fried's lawyers seem likely to paint as unflattering a portrait of Ellison as possible, casting her as a scorned woman with little confidence and bad business acumen. Bankman-Fried himself has leaked documents about her to the press, which led to the revocation of his bail and his pre-trial imprisonment.

;

;Federal attorneys have already made arguments that the exchange and the fund were run by immature risk-takers who eschewed basic business practices and duties to clients.

;

;“Before you started working at FTX, what did the defendant tell you about his relationship with Caroline Ellison?” prosecutor Danielle Sassoon asked ;Adam Yedidia; earlier this week, an FTX developer who was in Bankman-Fried's inner circle.

;

;“Sometime in early 2019, the defendant told me that he and Caroline had had sex and asked if it was a good idea for them to date,” Yedidia said.

;

;“What did you say?” she pressed, to which Yedidia replied: “I said no.”

;

;“[Bankman-Fried] said he figured that was reasonable and thought that I would say something like that,” Yedidia elaborated under further questioning.

;

;Even as early as last year, Ellison's statements in court during plea proceeding set the stage for testimony that would put Bankman-Fried at the center of an alleged fraud that siphoned $10bn from clients. “While I was co-CEO and then CEO, I understood that Alameda had made numerous, large illiquid venture investments and had lent money to Mr Bankman-Fried and other FTX executives,” Ellison admitted. Bankman-Fried, who is facing seven counts on fraud and conspiracy charges, has pleaded not guilty.

;

;Shortly after FTX and Alameda collapsed in November 2022, Ellison brokered a plea deal with prosecutors. She pled guilty to two counts of wire fraud and a host of financial conspiracy charges the next month. In exchange for cooperating, prosecutors will file a letter asking for Ellison's sentence to reflect her cooperation – if she fully complies and doesn't lie.

;

;“I agreed with Mr Bankman-Fried and others to provide materially misleading financial statements to Alameda's lenders,” she said in November, remarking later: “I am truly sorry for what I did. I knew that it was wrong,”

;

;The judge, Ronnie Abrams, said: “You mentioned that you knew that what you were doing was wrong. Did you also know that it was illegal?”

;

;“Yes,” Ellison said.

;

;Bankman-Fried's defense appears likely to cast Ellison as the party truly culpable for FTX and Alameda's collapse, having already derided her business decisions as damaging to both companies. When crypto seemed vulnerable in early 2022, Bankman-Fried asked Ellison to make moves that would insulate Alameda – but she didn't, defense attorney Mark Cohen said in his opening.

;

;“As the majority owner of Alameda, he spoke to Ms Ellison, the CEO, and he urged her to put on a hedge, something that would protect against such a downturn. She didn't do so at the time, and this also becomes an issue later on, when the storm hit,” Cohen said.

;

;“Sam acted in good faith and took reasonable business measures. He reviewed financial documents for both Alameda and FTX and believed they had the assets to weather the storm,” Cohen later said. “Things were tight, much tighter than they had been at the beginning of the year, and tight because earlier in the year Ms Ellison had not put on the hedges for Alameda, which would have offset some of this.”

;

;There is also reason to think Bankman-Fried's defense will try to undermine Ellison's reliability by casting her as a jilted lover. After writings from her diary appeared in; the New York Times;, Judge Lewis Kaplan revoked Bankman-Fried's bail. Prosecutors claimed that Bankman-Fried wanted to “interfere with a fair trial by an impartial jury” and “not only to harass Ellison, but also to deter other potential trial witnesses from testifying”. Kaplan found those allegations had probable cause.

;

;In the journal entries, Ellison voiced concern about her own leadership capabilities, writing: “Running Alameda doesn't feel like something I'm that; ;comparatively advantaged at or well-suited to do.” She also expressed sadness over her relationship with Bankman-Fried, saying: “I felt pretty hurt/rejected” and that cutting off communication “felt like the only way I could regain a sense of power”.

; Mon, 09 Oct 2023 18:22:01 +0800 Oil price leaps and airline shares fall after Hamas attack on Israelhttps://www.theguardian.com/business/2023/oct/09/oil-price-arms-firms-shares-hamas-attack-on-israel-bae-systems
;;2023-10-09T09:37:22Z;
;
;;Israeli soldiers gather near tanks
;

;Oil prices rose on Monday and airline shares fell as markets reacted to the surprise attack on Israel by the militant group Hamas.

;

;The Israeli prime minister, ;Benjamin Netanyahu;, said Israel was embarking on a “long and difficult war” against Hamas. The ;death toll has risen above 1,100; since fighting started on Saturday, and is expected to rise further.

;

;Investors on Monday morning appeared to be pricing in the prospect of more ;instability in the Middle East;.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Oil price jumps and airline shares fall as Hamas attack on Israel rattles markets – business live;

;
;

;Oil prices jumped by 3% on Monday morning. Futures prices for Brent crude oil, the North Sea benchmark, rose to $89 (£73) a barrel at one point, recovering some of the losses of the last week.

;

;London-headquartered FTSE 100 rivals BP and Shell rose by 3% and 2.7% respectively, while on the FTSE 250 Harbour Energy was up2%.

;

;Airlines were among the biggest stock market fallers on Monday morning, with international air travel already affected by the war.英国航空母公司国际航空集团股价下跌3.4%，易捷航空股价下跌4%。 The Paris-listed Air France-KLM lost 4.5%, and Germany's Lufthansa lost 3%.

;

;Several airlines have stopped flights to Tel Aviv's Ben Gurion airport, Israel's main international travel hub.其中包括美国联合航空公司、达美航空公司和美国航空公司、加拿大航空公司、德国汉莎航空公司和法国航空公司。据彭博社报道，英国航空公司调整了出发时间，并表示客户可以免费更改旅行日期。 About 16% of flights into and out of Ben Gurion on Monday were cancelled, according to the data company FlightAware.

;

;BAE Systems rose by 4.4%, making it the biggest riser on the FTSE 100. The company makes a wide range of weaponry, from tanks and fighter jets to ammunition and missiles. The German tankmaker Rheinmetall rose by 6.2%, while the Italian defence and aerospace company Leonardo gained 5.7%.

;

;Gold prices rose by 1%, as investors bought the traditional safe-haven asset.

;

;Israel's central bank stepped in to support its currency after the shekel fell to a near-eight-year low against the US dollar in early trading.以色列央行表示将在公开市场出售至多300亿美元外币以维持稳定，帮助谢克尔小幅回升。 The currency was already under pressure because of a dearth of international investment after Netanyahu's controversial plan to ;allow Israel's parliament to overrule its supreme court;.

;

;An index tracking the biggest companies on the Tel Aviv stock exchange fell by 6.5% on Sunday, before gaining slightly on Monday.

;

;Analysts at Deutsche Bank led by Jim Reid wrote in a note to clients that “geopolitical risk is elevated at the moment with the Ukraine conflict, the US/China tensions and now those resurfacing in the Middle East.”
